answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!There are two possibilities which should be seriously considered if anemia, hypothyroidism and diabetes are ruled out. One is a sleep disorder to be confirmed by sleep studies and the other is chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS).  You may sleep for 10 hours and not get up refreshed. cfs usually presents with widespread myalgia and arthralgia, headaches, chronic mental and physical exhaustion, cognitive difficulties, concentration difficulty and memory problems.I think you should discuss these possibilities with your doctor. It is difficult to comment beyond this without examining. A comprehensive investigation is required keeping all the points in mind. Hope this helps. Take care!

question: i have fatigue, headaches, sinus pain, nausea, low appetite, i sweat a lot, toothaches in upper tooth area but no teeth, and just feel yucky all over been going to the doc for about 4 years and all the basic blood test are normal and have had CT scans of nasal cavities, no infection that they saw. I have been on antibiotics to no avail, even had dentist x ray tooth area thinking there was something there, nothing . What should I do? work is hard to maintain now and i sleep a lot. HELP
title: I Give up
